title: Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR)
excerpt: Details the four main areas of forensic analysis: File System Analysis, Network Logs, System Logs, and System Memory.

full_content.heading: File System Analysis
full_content.intro: Examining a forensic image (a low-level copy) of a storage device reveals valuable information.
points: Information revealed includes installed programs, created or deleted files, and partially overwritten data.

full_content.heading: Network Logs
full_content.text: These logs capture network packet data, helping determine if an attack occurred, how it happened, and what systems were involved.

full_content.heading: System Logs
full_content.text: Logs stored by client and server systems record important events and activities that help investigators trace actions taken on a device.

full_content.heading: System Memory
full_content.text: Attackers may execute malicious programs directly in memory without saving them to disk, making memory analysis crucial.
